Pre-Game Insights: England are favourites to get the better of Scotland in their T20 World Cup 2024 opener, owing to the better quality of the players at their disposal, but they canâ€™t afford to take them lightly.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitches at the Kensington Oval are considered as the fastest among all the Caribbean nations, which allows the batters and fast bowlers to make a big impact most times, irrespective of the format.
The average first innings score at this venue is 156 in T20Is, but England will certainly try and post a total in the range of 200 runs to put Scotland out of the contest if they bat first.
Others: England squad for T20 World Cup 2024: Jos Buttler (c), Moeen Ali, Jofra Archer, Jonny Bairstow, Harry Brook, Sam Curran, Ben Duckett, Tom Hartley, Will Jacks, Chris Jordan, Liam Livingstone, Adil Rashid, Phil Salt, Reece Topley, Mark Wood

Scotland squad for T20 World Cup 2024: Richie Berrington (c), Matthew Cross, Brad Currie, Chris Greaves, Oli Hairs, Jack Jarvis, Michael Jones, Michael Leask, Brandon McMullen, George Munsey, Safyaan Sharif, Chris Sole, Charlie Tear, Mark Watt, Brad Wheal
